definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
a feast which also has a singing performance
lit. shoes and slippers muddled together (idiom); fig. many guests come and go/a lively party
young people decked out in gorgeous clothes (idiom)
reed-pipe wind instrument and vertical bamboo flute
qin and se, two string instruments that play in perfect harmony/marital harmony
to turn one's head and look around
drumming to make apricots flower, cf joke by Tang Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗, playing the drum in apricot blossom
to part for an unspecified period/to take leave from indefinitely
to live in luxury/lit. to ride a solid carriage pulled by fat horses
to sing to a string accompaniment/education (a reference to teaching the people Confucian values by means of song in ancient times)
